info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 3:24PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Butte, southwestern Meade and Lawrence Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 322 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles northwest of Saint Onge, or 6 miles southeast of Belle Fourche, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spearfish, Sturgis, Belle Fourche, Lead, Deadwood, Whitewood, Nemo, Nisland, Piedmont, Saint Onge, Vale, Central City, Fruitdale, Brownsville, Tilford, Fort Meade, and Terry Peak. This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 5 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
